alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 11:31PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Fayette and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past 30 minutes. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Collierville, Germantown, Cordova, Memphis, Piperton, Lenow, Fisherville, Kirk, White Station and Hickory Withe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
